title: Introduction to the ausbushfire
text: ausbushfire R package provides interactive interface explore key fire weather indices climate drivers Southeastern Australia 1979 2019, analyzing trends related Black Summer bushfires. Key Features Browse fire weather index (FWI) burned area map (slider year), Explore trends metrics like FWI, MSR, Tmax, Precip, IOD, SAM, Area Burned (filters), View relationships metrics scatter plots.

text: Select Year slider show map opacity based burned area, update fire risk (FWI) actual impact (Burned Area) relative long-term historical context. Example - Risk Map: opacity changes year slider, popup shows FWI burned area.

title: Introduction to the ausbushfire
text: Filter Year Range Metrics see volatility climate metrics time. Example: Time Series shows standardized metrics time trend line.

title: Introduction to the ausbushfire
text: Select two metrics see correlation time. Example: Scatter plot showing correlation selected fire metrics (FWI, Tmax, IOD, SAM).

title: ausbushfire: Australian Bushfire Explorer
text: ausbushfire R package designed explore trends climate drivers associated Australian bushfire risk Southeastern Australia (1979–2019). analysis grounded key meteorological indices major climate drivers, allowing users investigate increasing risk attributed changing climate conditions, including context devastating 2019–2020 ‘Black Summer’ fires. package ships small, tidy dataset (ausbushfire_data) Shiny application provide interactive interface data exploration trend analysis.

title: ausbushfire: Australian Bushfire Explorer
text: Risk Map (Tab 1): Visualizes defined study region Southeastern Australia dynamically highlights annual burned area intensity (km2\text{km}^2) 1997 onwards. Trend Analysis (Tab 2): Enables interactive comparison standardized metrics time exploration relationships different fire risk indicators. Climate Drivers: Focuses key factors like Fire Weather Index (FWI), Monthly Severity Rating (MSR), temperature (Tmax), precipitation, Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD), Southern Annular Mode (SAM).

title: ausbushfire: Australian Bushfire Explorer
text: can install development version ausbushfire directly GitHub using remotes package.

text: core data used throughout package Shiny application bundled ausbushfire_data object.

title: ausbushfire: Australian Bushfire Explorer
text: package includes comprehensive Shiny app (located inst/app/) interactively visualize data findings. Launch App can launch application directly installation exported function:

title: ausbushfire: Australian Bushfire Explorer
text: Risk Map: Use slider explore annual burned area fire risk status (FWI/Burned Area) Southeastern Australia. color intensity study region reflects severity fire season. Explore Trends: Select multiple standardized metrics (FWI, Tmax, IOD, Area Burned, etc.) visualize long-term trends volatility customizable time range. Relationship Metrics: Use scatter plot quickly assess correlation two climate drivers fire impact metrics (e.g., Tmax vs Area Burned).

title: ausbushfire: Australian Bushfire Explorer
text: analysis based inspired methodology data discussed following attribution study: Oldenborgh, G. J. van, Krikken, F., Lewis, S., et al. (2021). Attribution Australian bushfire risk anthropogenic climate change. Nat. Hazards Earth Syst. Sci., 21, 941–960. data derived KNMI Climate Explorer corresponding literature sources.

what: ausbushfire: Bushfire Explorer: Interactive Analysis of Australian Wildfires — ausbushfire-package
title: ausbushfire: Bushfire Explorer: Interactive Analysis of Australian Wildfires — ausbushfire-package
text: Provides interactive Shiny application supporting functions explore, visualize, analyze Australian bushfire data. package includes cleaned datasets, reproducible scripts, pkgdown-generated documentation website educational purposes.

text: Maintainer: HengHsieh Chang jessica830828@gmail.com

what: Southeastern Australia Bushfire Weather and Drivers (1979-2019) — ausbushfire_data
title: Southeastern Australia Bushfire Weather and Drivers (1979-2019) — ausbushfire_data
text: dataset containing key fire weather indices (FWI, MSR), climate drivers (temperature, precipitation, IOD, SAM), resulting burned area Southeastern Australia 1979 2019.

title: Southeastern Australia Bushfire Weather and Drivers (1979-2019) — ausbushfire_data
Southeastern Australia Bushfire Weather and Drivers (1979-2019) — ausbushfire_data
text: data frame 41 observations 8 variables: year observation year (1979-2019) fwi_sm highest 7-day mean FWI (FWI7x-SM) msr_sm maximum Monthly Severity Rating (MSR-SM) tmax Annual maximum 7-day mean maximum temperatures (TX7x) precip_total Total precipitation fire season (Sep-Feb) iod_mean Mean Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD) index Sep-Dec sam_mean Mean Southern Annular Mode (SAM) index Sep-Dec area_burned Total fire season burned area (MODIS, km2)

title: Southeastern Australia Bushfire Weather and Drivers (1979-2019) — ausbushfire_data
text: https://climexp.knmi.nl/bushfires_timeseries.cgi
